verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
There's a man in here who turns water to wine
And he walks on the water and gives sight to the blind
And he gives back life to the one that's dead
He fed four thousand with seven loaves of bread
Yes, there's a man in here who makes demons flee
He makes cripples to walk and He's chooses even me
And He lives in my heart and I'll have no fear
I'm a better man 'cause there's a man in here.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
There's a man in here that I'm looking for
Cried the man who could find no room at the door
So they lowered him down on a stretcher-bed
And Jesus looked at him and said
All your sins are now all gone this day
Take up your bed and go your way
As he walked through the crowd you could hear Him declare
I can tell you all that there's a man in there.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
There's a man in here, the disciples cried
As the ship was tossed from side to side
So they woke Him up as the waves grew high
And said, Don't you care that we're about to die?
And he said, Peace! Be still! And when the winds had laid
He said, Where's your faith why were you so afraid?
When they saw that the waves were smooth and clear
They said, Thank you, God, that there's a man in here!
